meanings.definition: To rise or fly upward with great force or speed.
meanings.sent1: The eagle upsoared into the sky effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The rocket upsoared into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.
meanings.sent3: The balloon upsoared so high that it almost touched the clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits upsoared when she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The kite upsoared with the strong gust of wind, dancing in the air.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The population of the city upsoared after the new factory opened.
meanings.sent2: The demand for the product upsoared during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The prices of the rare collectible upsoared, surprising the collectors.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement upsoared when she saw the amazing sales numbers.
meanings.sent5: The temperature upsoared, making it a scorching hot day.
